feed.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin

entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary:
The discussion centers around the development and implementation of post-quantum cryptography (PQC) safe schemes for Bitcoin to ensure enhanced security against potential quantum computing threats. A suggestion was made to devise new addresses or taproot versions specifically designed for PQC, which presents several advantages. Firstly, it would allow the public to track the adoption rate of these PQC schemes by monitoring how many coins are secured under this new system. This visibility could facilitate more informed decisions regarding adoption rates, planning, and gauging community sentiment towards the perceived quantum threat.
A distinct separation between PQC-secured addresses and those that are not would be clearly established. This distinction is crucial for users to easily recognize whether their assets are protected by post-quantum secure mechanisms. Moreover, it alleviates concerns for users indifferent to quantum threats by not burdening them with longer descriptors or unnecessary additional security layers that they might find cumbersome.
The proposal also suggests that such a clean separation would benefit library and wallet developers. Developers could achieve a more straightforward implementation process, enhancing user experience (UX) and user interface (UI). They would not have to navigate complexities arising from differentiating between legacy transaction routes and those secured by PQC, simplifying script codes and descriptions for end-users.
Furthermore, the concern is raised about the potential need for significant fee discounts to encourage the adoption of PQC transactions, recognizing that these might require more computational resources and space. However, it's also acknowledged that the enhanced security offered by adopting PQC could inherently serve as an incentive. The email implies caution against hastily incentivizing certain approaches without full confidence in their efficacy, suggesting a thoughtful consideration of methods before their widespread implementation.
This conversation highlights the importance of strategic planning and the careful consideration of incentives in the development of PQC solutions for Bitcoin. It underscores the need for a balance between advancing secure technologies and ensuring their practicality and accessibility for all users within the ecosystem.
